summary:
Romansh is a language spoken in Switzerland, mainly in the Grisons canton. It's one of Switzerland's four official languages, along with German, French, and Italian. Romansh developed from Latin and has been influenced by German.

There are five regional dialects, each with its own written form. A unified written language, Rumantsch Grischun, was created in 1982, but it's not universally accepted. Around 40,000 people speak Romansh as their primary language, mostly in Grisons.
title: Romansh language
